summary: An idiom is a word or phrase which means something different from its literal meaning.
full_text:
An idiom  is a phrase or a fixed expression that has a figurative, or sometimes literal, meaning. An idiom's figurative meaning is different from the literal meaning. There are thousands of idioms, and they occur frequently in all languages. It is estimated that there are at least twenty-five thousand idiomatic expressions in the English language. Idioms fall into the category of formulaic language.
^ See The Oxford companion to the English language .
^ Concerning the estimate of the number of idioms in the English language, see Jackendoff .
title: Idiom
